Class CollisionAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • CollisionAlgorithm

  • public class CollisionAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    This class calculates and implements the specific algorithm necessary when the frog collides with any moving object in the game
    Version:
    May 21, 2016
    Author:
    Vaishnav Balaji, Period: 5, Assignment: Frogger Final Project, Sources: None

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Frogger f
      Frogger object that represents the user controlled frog in the game
      Colliders frogSphere
      Collider object that represents the location at which a collision occurs
      int river_y0
      River bounds for the bottom of the world
      int river_y1
      River bounds for the top of the world
      int road_y0
      Road bounds for the bottom of the world
      int road_y1
      Road bounds for the top of the world

    • Method Detail

      • collisionTest

        public void collisionTest(jig.engine.physics.AbstractBodyLayer<DynamicObject> layer)
        Tests if there has been a collision on the screen. The result is the frog dying or proceeding. This includes going off of the screen or colliding into one of the obstacles
        Parameters:
        layer - the different dynamic objects that the frog can collide with

      • checkBounds

        public boolean checkBounds()
        Checks if the frog is in the world's bounds
        Returns:
        true or false, depending on if the frog is in bounds

      • inWater

        public boolean inWater()
        Checks if the frog is in the water (river)
        Returns:
        true or false, depending on the frog's location

      • onPath

        public boolean onPath()
        Checks if the frog is on the road
        Returns:
        true or false, depending on the location of the frog

      • collision

        public void collision(DynamicObject d,
                      Colliders c)
        Deals with the collision, depending on whether the object with which the frog collides with is an obstacle or a pad/crocodile/turtle. If the Dynamic Object is a car/copcar/truck, the frog will die. If the object is a pad/crocodile/turtle, the frog will hop on and continue the game.
        Parameters:
        d - the object which which the frog collides
        c - the collider object that the frog collides with
